Plays > The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

– Click image to view.

The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

(染模様妹背門松) (Somemoyō imose no kadomatsu)

Written By: Suga Sensuke (菅専助)

First Staged: 1767

Reference: Hironaga, Shūzaburō, The Bunraku Handbook (Tokyo: Maison des Arts, 1976); Bunraku May 1976, November 1984 Performance Programs

Kashira:

Wakaotoko (若男)

Tedai (手代)

Decchi (丁稚)

Genta (源太)

Shinzō (新造)

Kenbishi (検非違使)

Fukeoyama (老女形)

Darasuke (陀羅助)

Hayaku (端役)

Musume (娘)

Matahei (又平)

Shiratayū (白太夫)

Sanmaime (tedai) (三枚目（手代）)

Sadanoshin (定之進)

Hanaugoki (鼻動き)

Bannai (伴内)

Onoemon (斧右衛門)

Nemuri no musume (ねむりの娘)

Performances:

February 1968: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

October 1971: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

May 1976: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1977: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

September 1980: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

November 1984: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1992: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

February 1990: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

January 1998: The Love of Osome and Hisamatsu

Scenes:

The Daianji River Bank (大安寺堤)

The Castle Gate (楼門)

Kanki's Mansion (See also The Shishigajo Catsle) (甘輝館 (See also 獅子が城))

The Red Signal (See also The Shishigajo Catsle) (紅流し (See also 獅子が城))

Characters:

Osome (娘お染)

Hisamatsu (丁稚久松)

Zenroku (番頭善六)

Rin (下女りん)

Tasaburo (伜多三郎)

Oito (芸妓おいと)

Seibei (山家屋清兵衛)

Okatsu (母おかつ)

Genemon (大阪屋源右衛門)

Rihei (小道具屋利兵衛 )

Ballad book peddler (祭文売り(門つけ))

Pawnshop customer (質受男)

Female pawner (質入女房 (質置嬶))

Kyusaku (百姓久作 )

Tarobei (親(油屋)太郎兵衛)

Maids (下女)
